channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hunter Biden’s Former Partners Describe Toll of His Drug Abuse
item.description: His ex-wife and an ex-girlfriend painted a portrait of a family man who was falling into an abyss of addiction and living a lavish, party-hopping high life in New York and Los Angeles.

item.title: Santiago Power Outage Leaves Over 400,000 Without Electricity
item.description: A tree fell on a high-voltage transmission tower early Thursday, knocking out power to parts of the Chilean capital.

item.title: IRS says it will refund taxes extracted from Ohioans who got financial assistance after Norfolk Southern derailment disaster
item.description: “I don’t know why they didn’t do that from the very beginning,” East Palestine resident Misti Allison said.

item.title: With Elections, Europe Is Coming Alive
item.description: The European Union’s democratic deficit is slowly beginning to evaporate.

item.title: Train Crash in Czech Republic Kills 4, Injures More Than 20
item.description: The passenger train was traveling overnight when it hit a freight train.

item.title: Zero percent down mortgages might help more first-time homebuyers break into the housing market—but there are caveats
item.description: United Wholesale Mortgage announced a 0% down program last month, and since then it’s been all the rage, but people are split: Does it eliminate a barrier or will it launch us into another subprime mortgage crisis?

item.title: D-Day at 80
item.description: This anniversary of World War II’s pivotal battle has a somber tone, as the event disappears from living memory and extremism again threatens Europe.

item.title: Passenger Train Crashes in Czech Republic
item.description: Emergency service workers helped passengers and their luggage off of the wrecked train.

item.title: Kansas politicians relaunch effort to steal Kansas City Chiefs from neighboring Missouri after a $1 billion taxpayer-funded plan fizzled
item.description: After an earlier stadium-financing plan fell through, Kansas legislators are trying a new tactic to bring the Chiefs across the state border.

item.title: Inside Sde Teiman, the Base Where Israel Detains Gazans
item.description: Since Israel invaded Gaza, the Sde Teiman military base has filled with blindfolded, handcuffed detainees, held without charge or legal representation.

item.title: In Global Elections, Strongmen Are Taken Down a Notch
item.description: In Turkey, India and elsewhere, where some feared authoritarian leaders would consolidate power, democracy has proved surprisingly resilient.

item.title: Short seller Scorpion Capital accuses Japan’s most actively traded company of being the ‘largest outright fraud in the world’
item.description: Hedge fund targets niche semiconductor company that’s rode AI demand for huge gains since 2019.

item.title: The Rise and Fall of BNN Breaking, an AI-Generated News Outlet
item.description: BNN Breaking had millions of readers, an international team of journalists and a publishing deal with Microsoft. But it was just an A.I. chop shop.

item.title: Thursday Briefing
item.description: War in Sudan caused the world’s largest displacement crisis.

item.title: New York governor abruptly cancels nation's first 'congestion pricing' system that would have charged $15 to drive into midtown Manhattan
item.description: The $15 charge "can break the budget of a hardworking or middle class household," Kathy Hochul said.
